issue.title: [C++[ arrow::gpu::CudaContext::bytes_allocated() isn't defined
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1776](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1776). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
arrow/gpu/cuda_context.h declares arrow::gpu::CudaContext::bytes_allocated() but it's not defined.
Should it be removed or defined?

CudaContext::CudaContextImple::bytes_allocated() exists. So it's easy to define it.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1776?focusedCommentId=16242136) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yes, it should be defined

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1776?focusedCommentId=16243959) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Resolved by PR https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1293
